Hi,

A solution is obtained from 1st running with high CURVE value in the p=
rimixed flame code in Python or Matlab. I want to use the solution as the s=
tarting estimate with low CURVE value. In Chemkin, the keyword "RSTR" is us=
ed the same function..

Do you know how to use a previouly comuted solution=
 in Cantera?
